I am not concerned about chaff; it is no good to give to hungry people, but if he is very anxious about chaff let him go down to his own part of the country and give it to the people. I am ready to meet Deputy Hughes up there if he goes there.
If you go up there, you will get your eyes opened.
There is no question of political capital as Deputy Hughes said about this; not a bit. There is room enough, for all of us.
In your own districts.
There may be another man in your district.
He is welcome if he comes.
Perhaps Deputy Gorey will be allowed to continue.
That is all I have to say. The Minister has avoided the main question which is the need of expending money for the protection of the food of the people.
That is what we pay departmental officials for.
That is no protection; The departmental officials are not doing it. I travel a lot and I know that you are not able to confine this infection.
Question put.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Defence whether he is aware that no payment of dependant's allowance, granted to Mrs. D. Ramsey, Berries, Athlone, in respect of her son, Second Lieut. W. Ramsey, has yet been made; and to ask that payment be expedited.
An allowance of 14s. per week is now being issued to Mrs. Ramsey on combined claims in respect of her sons David and Thomas, and arrears have been paid.

Speaker.hpid: SEAN O LAIDHIN SEAN O LAIDHIN
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Defence whether he is aware that Mrs. Winnery, Bastion Street, Athlone, has not received dependant's allowance in respect of her son, Vol. W. Winnery, who joined the Army in June, 1922, and was stationed in Ballinrobe up to January, 1923, when he died from pneumonia contracted whilst acting as dispatch rider; to ask that settlement of this claim be expedited and arrears paid up.
Mrs. Winnery is being paid an allowance of 7s. per week, which was assessed on the combined claims in respect of her sons Michael and William. There are no arrears due to her.

Speaker.hpid: SEAN O LAIDHIN SEAN O LAIDHIN
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Defence whether he will expedite payment of dependant's allowance to Mrs. Mary Mullins, Clara Road, Moate, in respect of her son William, who joined the National Army in May, 1922, and who earned £1 17s. 6d. per week before joining, and is at present stationed in Athlone.
An allowance has now been issued to Mrs. Mullins, and arrears have been paid.

Speaker.hpid: SEAN O LAIDHIN SEAN O LAIDHIN
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Defence whether he is aware that no dependant's allowance has been paid to Mr. John Fay, Ballinacargy, in respect of his son, Vol. John Fay, who joined the National Army 3rd May, 1922, and is now stationed at the Viceregal Lodge, Phoenix Park, Dublin; and whether, as this family is in poor circumstances owing to the son's absence, the Minister will see that an allowance be granted.
An allowance is now being issued to Mr. Fay, and arrears have been paid.

MainHeading.Title: [ WRITTEN ANSWERS. ] - AN ARREST AT TUAM.

Speaker.hpid: TOMAS O CONAILL TOMAS O CONAILL
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Defence whether he is aware that a youth named James Geddes, aged 17 years, was arrested in Tuam on January 27th, and after being detained in Tuam for a fortnight, was taken to Galway Jail, where he is still imprisoned; if he will say whether any charge has been preferred against Geddes, or whether it is proposed to bring him to trial, or, in view of his age and the fact that he was attending school, is he prepared to consider favourably the question of his immediate release.
Geddes was arrested on the ground of actively assisting Irregulars on intelligence work. It is not intended to put him on trial, and it is not considered advisable to release him at present.

MainHeading.Title: [ WRITTEN ANSWERS. ] - LOUGHREA COMPENSATION CLAIM.

Speaker.hpid: THOMAS O CONAILL THOMAS O CONAILL
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Defence what is the reason for the delay in payment of the claim of Mrs. Killeen, Loughrea, for compensation for personal property destroyed during the occupation of the Central Hotel, Loughrea, by troops from 1st April, 1922, to 10th July, 1922, and whether he will expedite settlement of the claim.

Mrs. Killeen's claim had to await the setting up of machinery for dealing with claims of the kind. A payment on account has now been made by the Office of Public Works, which is responsible for settling the claim.

MainHeading.Title: [ WRITTEN ANSWERS. ] - SKILLED TRADESMEN'S ARMY ALLOWANCE.

Speaker.hpid: CATHAL O SEANAIN CATHAL O SEANAIN
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Defence what is the practice in regard to the time and method of payment of the daily allowance to skilled tradesmen enlisted in the Army, and whether he will arrange for the immediate payment of the allowances due to Vol. Dick Ingham, No. 3083, Engineers' Barracks, Curragh Camp, now residing at 18 Owen Roe Terrace, Cavan, in respect of his service in the Army from 21st July, 1922, to 6th January, 1923.

Additional pay at the flat rate of 3s. per day is issued weekly to skilled tradesmen who are soldiers and who are employed at their trades in the Army. Volunteer Ingham was employed as a labourer, and additional pay was not, therefore, payable to him.

MainHeading.Title: [ WRITTEN ANSWERS. ] - EX-OFFICER'S SALARY.

Speaker.hpid: THOMAS O CONAILL THOMAS O CONAILL
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Defence whether he has received a complaint from ex-Battalion Adjutant Mr. J. Hargrove, of Gort, to the effect that, while he left Gort Barracks on April 5th, 1923, he was paid his wages of £4 per week only to January 1st, 1923; whether it is a fact that other Battalion Adjutants similarly circumstanced were paid to 1st March or 17th March; and whether the balance alleged to be due to Mr. Hargrove will be paid him.

Hargrove's case was not similar to that of other Battalion Adjutants. He was never formally attached to the Army, and his services were not required after the 1st January. He did not work after that date, but was permitted to live in barracks on the plea that he would be in danger of hostile action by Irregulars if he returned home. It is not intended to issue any further pay to him.
